block.p: Kenneth D. Kaunda, one of Africa's grand old men, is a free man again. After keeping the former President in jail or under house arrest for more than five months, Zambian prosecutors dropped all charges against him. Their case had always looked weak. Mr. Kaunda was originally accused of plotting a bungled coup attempt last October.

Kenneth D. Kaunda, one of Africa's grand old men, is a free man again. After keeping the former President in jail or under house arrest for more than five months, Zambian prosecutors dropped all charges against him. Their case had always looked weak. Mr. Kaunda was originally accused of plotting a bungled coup attempt last October.
Diplomatic sources said President Nelson Mandela of South Africa brokered a deal -- free Mr. Kaunda, who ruled Zambia from 1964 to 1991, and he would return to retirement. But probably not quietly.
